intro: Pavetta longistipulata, commonly known as the long-stipule pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with long, slender stipules. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, often with four to five petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Pavetta longistipulata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
